content.description: Start on the same start as Road to Mordor. This start sequence is the crux of the climb. Instead of traversing left under the roof, continue straight up and right on the face above.  You might think your next crux would be at the baby roof, mid way up the climb, where you go straight instead of left following RTM, but that move isn't too bad.  Up a little higher, you have to look around more for feet, but they're there. This line is well protected!

Arching crack that traverses left below the obvious roof above. Start right with a short, standing start, V1- boulder problem then it lets up to some easy 5.7 climbing once you're over the lip. Then head up to the roof and follow it left. You can finish by lowering off on the fixed gear or get a workout on the top half of Blue Tail Rising. A really fun route with movement you don't see everyday.  If you go for the link up make sure to bring a 70m rope.
content.protection: 10 bolts plus anchors, Stick-clip recommended due to the landing area.
content.location: Start right of Fight or Flight.

content.description: 70 meter rope recommended, if you're doing both pitches at once, otherwise a 60M works great. P1: Bouldery crux start pushes past the lower small roof to a small ledge. Stem past the next several bolts to gain the slab under the obvious, main roof. You will feel the roof crux immediately when it forces several reaches and sustained movement. A section of vertical face leads to the first pitch rap anchors. 10d, 80ft P2: Past the first rap anchors, the climbing terrain turns to easier slab and follows a handful of bolts to a second set of rap anchors, towards the top of the pillar. Requires a 70M rope or double rope rap from this point of the climb. 5.5, 35ft
content.protection: Quick Draws, perma-draw rap anchors provided
content.location: 10 ft. right of Blue Tail Rising

content.description: A funky challenge with a tough belay area.
content.location: First route you come to after taking a left at the bottom of the stairs.

content.description:
Thanks to Norm Reed, this wonderful line heads out the left side of the Grotto Wall's main roof. Permadraws provided through the roof crux section. P1: Start by following a dihedral feature up the lower face. Head slight left, at the roof, then straight up through several power demanding pulls to reach the set of rap anchors. 10+, 75ft  P2: Continue following a line of bolts up easier slab to reach the second set of rap anchors at the top of the pillar. 5.5, 40ft

70M rope required or double rope rap off the top of the second pitch.
content.protection: 14 bolts + anchors. Perma-draws at the crux and perma-biners on the anchors.

content.description: Scramble up the start, to below the first bolt.  A consistently technical route with periodic rests. In the top half you wish for more feet for a few moves.  Also staying in the bolt line at the top, can make it harder. Stay left of the bolt line for an easier time through the crux section. Lots of fun.  Perma-draws at the top.
content.location: Just past Corey's Kazoo on the arete.

content.description: Wall: This distinctly vertical white face has a mid roof section and is definitely worth a visit.Routes are roughly 80 ft tall and provide a range of moderates to more difficult levels (range from 5.8 to 5.11). Multi-pitch options offer 120 ft two pitch climbs and a couple different link up of routes can change things up and provide a few more challenges. Perma-draws are provided through the crux sections of several of the routes on this wall. Enjoy your workout!Ratings: While easier climbs are given a rating number representing the climb to be no harder than the rating represented, routes rated 5.10 and up are given a specific max crux rating. This should help you plan your visit and navigate your way along the bluff while using Mountain Project.Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
